para.text: There is established as a special fund the Neighborhood Safety and Engagement Fund ("Fund"), which shall be administered by the Mayor in accordance with subsection (c) of this section.
Funds from the following sources shall be deposited into the Fund:
Fifty percent of all net revenue collected pursuant to§ 36-621.11(a)(3); and
Money in the Fund shall only be used to support the duties of the Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement as described in § 7-2411(b).

The money deposited into the Fund but not expended in a fiscal year shall not revert to the unassigned fund balance of the General Fund of the District of Columbia at the end of a fiscal year, or at any other time.
Subject to authorization in an approved budget and financial plan, any funds appropriated in the Fund shall be continually available without regard to fiscal year limitation.

annotations.annotation: Applicability of D.C. Law 21-125: § 901 of D.C. Law 21-125 provided that the change made to this section by § 103 of D.C. Law 21-125 is subject to the inclusion of the law’s fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan. Therefore that amendment has not been implemented.
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 3032(c) of Fiscal Year 2018 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2017 (D.C. Act 22-104, July 20, 2017, 64 DCR 7032).
For temporary (90 days) repeal of § 901 of D.C. Law 21-125, see § 7014 of Fiscal Year 2018 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2017 (D.C. Act 22-104, July 20, 2017, 64 DCR 7032).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 3032(c) of Fiscal Year 2018 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2017 (D.C. Act 22-167, Oct. 24, 2017, 64 DCR 10802).
For temporary (90 days) repeal of § 901 of D.C. Law 21-125, see § 7014 of Fiscal Year 2018 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2017 (D.C. Act 22-167, Oct. 24, 2017, 64 DCR 10802).
Section 7014 of D.C. Law 22-33 repealed § 901 of D.C. Law 21-125. Therefore the changes made to this section by D.C. Law 21-125 have been implemented.
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Community Violence Intervention Fund Emergency Amendment Act of 2018 (D.C. Act 22-393, June 29, 2018, 65 DCR 7341).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement Fund Emergency Amendment Act of 2018 (D.C. Act 22-462, Oct. 3, 2018, 65 DCR 11370).
For temporary (225 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Community Violence Intervention Fund Temporary Amendment Act of 2018 (D.C. Law 22-162, Oct. 11, 2018, 65 DCR 7707).

For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement Fund Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2018 (D.C. Act 22-549, Dec. 26, 2018, 66 DCR 223).
For temporary (225 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement Fund Temporary Amendment Act of 2018 (D.C. Law 22-198, Feb. 22, 2019, 65 DCR 12026).
For temporary (90 days) repeal, see § 3042(b) of Fiscal Year 2020 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2019 (D.C. Act 23-91, July 22, 2019, 66 DCR 8497).
For temporary (90 days) repeal, see § 3042(b) of Fiscal Year 2020 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2019 (D.C. Act 23-112, Sept. 4, 2019, 66 DCR 11964).

For temporary (90 days) revival and amendment of this section, see § 6 of Fiscal Year 2020 Budget Support Clarification Second Emergency Amendment Act of 2019 (D.C. Act 23-201, Jan. 22, 2020, 67 DCR 731).
Section 16 of D.C. Law 23-68 provided that the changes made to this section by D.C. Law 23-68 shall apply as of October 1, 2019.

Applicability of D.C. Law 23-234: § 4 of D.C. Law 23-234 provided that the change made to this section by § 3 of D.C. Law 23-234 is subject to the inclusion of the law’s fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan. Therefore that amendment has not been implemented.
According to the Office of the Budget Director, D.C. Law 23-234 is currently funded. Therefore, this section has been implemented.
